> As Remus approached where Cyclonus stood, it was a strange =
scene that
> presented itself - Sweeps swirled in the skies and others emer=
ged out
> of a deep cave. There is the smell of newly turned earth as if so=
me

> =
benefiting from the Matrix, his optics glowing as he radiated some new
> po=
wer, and most horrifying of all, there was no hint of the earlier
> damage =
he had recieved in his battle with Rodimus.

> Cyclonus stood before fi=
ve cybertronian forms, warriors from their
> build and weapon distribution.=
 They each lay on the ground and looked

sive damage, but otherwise repairable.

eived this damage quite some time

> Cyclonus turned to look at Re=
mus, and for the briefest of moments a
> strange mosaic of emotions passed =
fleetingly across his face -
> enlightenment? anger? frustration? wonder? i=
t is difficult to define,
> but then all too quickly disappear as he spoke,=
 "You speak of things
> that you have no knowledge of Maximal. Silence woul=
d be your ally now."

> 
> As Cyclonus spoke several Sweeps in robot mode=
 stepped up to Remus from
> the sides and rear, weapons trained on him, the=
y reach out to hold him
> in place. At the same time Cyclonus turned away f=
rom Remus to gaze upon
> the forms before him.

> "I did not allow your =
presence here to bandy useless words with you."
> Cyclonus' voice is clear =
and powerful as he directed his words to
> Remus, "No doubt you have report=
ed our position to your comrades, but
> it is of no consequence, they will =
arrive too late." Cyclonus gestured

you will be able to report this to
> your superiors. Let them know the gift=
 they have given us."

> Cyclonus stood still for a moment as more Sweeps=
 stepped to Remus' side

 Cyclonus began

 power,

d
